meanings.definition: A rectangular block of clay baked by the sun or in a kiln, used as a building material.
meanings.sent1: The house was made of red bricks.
meanings.sent2: The mason carefully laid each brick in place.
meanings.sent3: Why did the silly brick go to school? To become a smart building material!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as solid as a brick, unwavering in the face of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The sound of bricks falling echoed through the construction site.

meanings.definition: A large quantity or number of something, typically money.
meanings.sent1: He saved up enough bricks to buy a new bike.
meanings.sent2: The company invested bricks in the new project.
meanings.sent3: The piggy bank was so full of bricks, it could hardly hold any more!
meanings.sent4: She stacked up bricks of cash, ready to make a big purchase.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was overflowing with golden bricks of coins.
